title: Great Table Linen available here!
text:
We visited this store looking for some souvenirs to take back to Australia. The staff were very helpful and the table linens were beautiful and with reasonable prices. We purchased a table cloth for our mother and some tea towels as gifts for family members.
The store has a good range of Olive Oil Soap and some pretty dresses too.
Well worth a vist for nice souvenirs!!

title: Second visit this year!!
text:
We stayed here in March this year and were very pleased to return.
The purpose of our current visit is to have massages from Basheer who is a master masseuse. Basheer and his team will give you a relaxing massage if this is what you need but if you have a specific problem area, discuss this with Basheer and he will be able to treat that issue - if not he will tell you. My husband has a spinal disability and basheer's massages make a huge difference to his mobility and comfort. I had a foot massage from Vaser and this also has made a difference and has decreased my foot pain.
We always thoroughly enjoy our time at the Parkroyal Penang - the hotel is very clean and tidy, the staff are all extremely polite, helpful and courteous.
We would like to mention the reception staff members Yazim and Eita and the waiters Abid and Rizaz who all gave us extremely good service with a smile!!
We would recommend this hotel to our frineds and we will be back!!

title: The best icecream/gelato we have ever tasted!
text: We thoroughly enjoyed this atrisan gelato which is the creamiest ice treat we have eaten. The flavours are very different and delicious - I tried the Strawberry Cheese cake and Mango flavours and will try the Noir Vanilla next time I see a Davinci Shop.

title: Lovely waterfront tables and good food.
text: We ate here once during our stay in Heraklion. Our meals were Grilled Sea Bass for me and a Burger for my husband. Both meals were very tasty and I thoroughly enjoyed my Bass. We ate at tables in the sea front area and it was a very nice place to sit, chat and eat!

title: Well worth a visit
text: Look for the model of the Palace of Knossos to see the sheer size of the place. There are many different exhibits in this museum and it is well worth it to take your time to see all that is included.

title: Right in the centre of town
text: We saw this fountain many times as we wanrered around the Tourist area. Most places can be found from this fountain as it is quite a landmark.

title: Very interesting !!
text:
We wandered around this ancient site for several hours and were amazed by the sheer size. The ruins are spread over a large and the ground is not totally flat so solid shoes are a bonus. There are some interesting things to see if you have time and energy to walk around the side and rear paths as this aspect give you a different view of the palace ruins.
If you visit the Heraklion Museum, there is a model of what this place would have looked like - worth a visit!!

title: What BIG Meals and plates!!!
text:
We ate at Orgy twice and were delighted with the meals and service. The owner was pleasantly chatty and gave us some information about places out of the city to visit. We are from Australia and really appreciated the information he shared with us.
If you eat there please try the breaded mushrooms ... these would be the best mushrooms I have ever eaten and the schnitzels are huge and tasty!
We heartily recommend Orgy Cafe for reasonably priced and delicious meals!!

title: Great place to stay
text:
We were very happy with our 6 days here. Our room was very clean, tidy and nice (except for the wardrobe door that would not stay shut in spite of being reported twice) and the beds were very comfortable with sufficient pillows and covers provided.
There are two entrances - one from the street and the other from the front court area where the old olive tree is growing.
Breakfast was included and provided ample choices for all tastes. There was very nice brewed coffee, hot water for tea and instant coffee too. The breakfast room has several tables on the balcony area so don't forget to look around.
The hotel staff were very helpful and offered information on how to see all the best places.
We had an issue with our mobile phone and the staff rang our contact in Penang (our next stop) for us and we were able to confirm our bookings. Thank you so much!!

title: Delicious Italian Food
text: We ate here while in Athens and would recomend it to others. I had 'Little greek Girl Spaghetti' - delicious and my husband had a delish Pasta dish.

title: Great coffee served here!!
text: We stopped here with a tour group for a pit stop and had a cappuccino coffee each which was delicious. The staff at the coffee counter were friendly and courteous given that we speak no Greek!

title: Meat soups and more!
text:
My husband and I had seen this restaurant on TV and thought we would try it while in Athens. It is situated in the Athens Central Meat Market and provides quite a choice of meat soups, roast vegetables etc. We both ate soup - I had goat soup and hubby had beef soup but don't think the soup is a small meal!! The bowls are full of meat on the bone or meat chunks, and large vegetable pieces ... absolutely delicious!!!
We would visit again if we are in Athens in the future.

title: Best gyros we had in Athens
text:
We ate here several times during our 11 day stay in Athens and thoroughly enjoyed the gyros wraps. We don't eat garlic sauce and the cook was happy to make ours as requested ... and ... the chips are the best chips we have tasted in a while.
The cafe is one of the last on the street past the Acropolis Metro but really worth the walk to find it!

title: What a lovely meal!
text:
We went to Mani Mani for my birthday dinner and how lovely it was.
The restaurant is upstairs in Falirou Street in a property that looks like a private home. The green sign on the front of the building says ManhManh so it could be easily missed.
Once inside, the staff are very helpful and attentive and the meal was delicious. I had Sea Bass on a bed of rice and spinach before devouring the delicious Greek desert, "Halva". The ambience of the restaurant is very homey and welcoming!
This was the perfect end to a great birthday celebration!

title: Good Greek Tucker!!
text:
We ate here several times over the 11 days we stayed in Athens and enjoyed most meals especially the Greek Salad which was a huge serve. The wrapped Gyros were very tasty but we were surprised by the addition of chips!
Prices were reaonable and a table was usually easy to get no matter what time we ate.

title: Wonderful 4 days !!
text:
We took the 4 day Classical Greece & Meteora - First Class Tour from Athens in early October 2019 and after a short wait we were shown to our bus for the trip to begin.
First, we met Eva our Tour Guide - she is a very delightful young woman who has an extensive knowledge of Greek history and Greek Mythology, which made the tour so much more interesting. At every stop, Eva was able to expalin how the myths generally had an element of truth which pointed to an historical fact.
Our very competant driver Panos was very good and as we sat in the front of the bus we were able to observe his use of the road and his care when driving ... well done Panos!!!
During this tour, we saw many amazing places such as Epidauras, Olympia, the Sanctury of the Olympian Zeus, Delphi, Kalambaka, Meteora where we saw the amazing Byzantine Monastaries perched high on the hilltops.
Four days well spent thanks to Eva for her knowledge and Panos for his driving skill!

title: Very nice Hotel!
text: We stayed here on day 3 of our tour and really enjoyed our short stay. There is ample parking and across the road is a nice collection of shops to visit. We enjoyed a delicious evening meal and breakfast with plenty of choices. The dining room was quite large so the eating spaces were not over crowded.

title: Nice little Hotel
text: We stayed here on night 2 of our tour and enjoyed a refreshing welcome glass of juice on arrival and a tasty evening meal and breakfast the following morning. It is a pretty hotel and has a lovely reception area with many decorative panels behind the desk. It appeared to have limited street parking which made it difficult for the bus to pull up easily.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: We stayed here for one night on our 4 Day Classical Greece & Meteora - first class tour. We enoyed a delicious evening meal in the dining room before heading to bed and in the morning we enjoyed a filling breakfast in the breakfast room before heading off on day two. The Arty Grand is a lovely hotel with a seperate pool and a garden area in the rear of the hotel. The entrance has plenty of off road parking and a stairs to the entry doors.

title: WOW!!
text: As we arrived at the Acropolis and climbed our way to the entry point we were amazed at the sight of all the structures on this hilltop. There are many remains here and it is benefitial to grab a map to understand how the place would have functioned in bygone times. If you allow your imagination to run free, you can imagine how beautiful these temples etc would be in the bright Grecian sunlight.

title: Amazing sight!
text: We walked to the Acropolis and were stunned by the magnitude of the Parthenon... it is now just a skeleton of what it must have been but none the less is an awesome sight. Allow your imagination to soar and think of how stunningly beautiful this place would have been in it's heyday! The grounds are littered with bulding blocks, tops of pillars etc which give a clue to how it would have looked.

title: Amazing underground ruins!
text:
This museum is extremely important as it holds many artifacts of historical importance relating to the amazing Acropolis. Taking photos is only permitted on the ground floor and the underground ruins but on other floors where the ancient exhibits are displayed there are no photos permitted.
Allow plenty of time for your visit and be prepared for there to be many people visiting too.

title: Nice food !
text: We stayed next door to Caffe 66 at the NHLFix Hotel and ate here on a couple of occasions as we walked to and from the nearby Metro station. Caffe 66 is open from 6am until 5pm and offers a nice variety of food and drinks.

title: Fantastic Hotel and Fantastic staff
text:
We travelled from South Australia and stayed here in total for 11 nights (with a 4 day Tour in between our stays).
The Hotel staff, especially Vasilis, Vasia and VIcky are extremely helpful, courteous and very professional, which makes it easy to approach them all for information and directions. The cleaning staff are very efficient and helpful too.
Our rooms were on the 6th floor and were, on both occasions, extremely clean, spacious and included an adequately equipped kitchen with hotplate, fridge, kettle and coffee maker. The shower was great with good pressure and the bed was really comfortable and had plenty of good pillows.
There is a Metro station a few minutes walk from the Hotel and the Acropolis is approx 800metres away if you care to walk there. The Metro makes it very easy to get to most archeological sites and on warm or wet days makes travel much easier.
In the nearby streets you will find many restaurants and eating houses as well as laundromats and supermarkets. Within two blocks we found 2 laundromats and 1 drycleaner so it is easy to pack light to make room for all your souveniers. The laundromat we used cost 5 Euro to wash and 2 Euro to dry per load.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and will definately recommend this hotel to our friends. It was one of the best hotels we have stayed in and was made so by the exceptional staff.

title: Great HOT coffee!!
text: We visited this Cafe a few weeks away and rested after walking through the interesting town. We enjoyed a delicious, HOT coffee.. and it was hot not luke warm which was great on a cool day! The service was great and will repeat our visit here the next time we are in Hahndorf!!

title: Butterflies and more!!
text: We visited here several years ago and Oh My! how it has grown! It is now named Entopia and houses many butterflies, lizards and Insects. On entry we were offered the ability to release a butterfly that had just left its cocoon which was a lovely touch, well explained by the young staff member. There are many attractions for the children including the Pandora Forest, Mystery Cave and David's Garden. This place is well worth seeing even if you have been here before!

title: A Crafter's Paradise !
text:
As a Crafter I am always excited to find a store where I can purchase items to use in the crafts I enjoy - scrapbooking, sewing, quilting, making greeting cards and journals.
This store has an amazing array of lace, ribbons, beads and buttons at very fair prices compared to those at home.
place: Soo Thong Handicrafts And Tailoring Articles Co.

title: Wonderful place when things go bad with your travel plans!
text:
We were accommodated by Singapore Airlines in the Crowne Plaza after a delay saw us miss our connecting flight home. We were able stay here while we waited for the next available flight out of Singapore to Adelaide the next evening.
Our room was very clean, tidy and had a very comfortable bed which was most welcome after the stress of missing the flight.
Staff at this hotel (our second stay here) are very helpful and our requests for toothbrushes etc, were granted very swiftly.
The meals served here are exceptional and I doubt any guest could complain about the food choice. Waiting staff are very obliging and are happy to have a chat and a laugh!
We are very thankful to Singapore Airlines and Crowne Plaza for making our layover so stress free!!

title: Very Long and busy Jetty
text: We visited Chew Jetty and enjoyed the sights and sounds of the place. There are a few "Street Art" pieces to see, many boats including the long boat and many stores to purchase gifts from. We were not here long but did enjoy our time there!

title: Great views of Penang
text:
We went up to the Top to see the Rainbow Sky Walk and the view over Penang!
There is a whole lot more there apart from the Sky Walk but as we are elderly we did not visit the Kid Friendly areas - Jurassic Research Centre, The Gravityz, Ocean Explorer etc.
I am sure there are many young people who would love to spend all day here!!

title: Long Way Up!
text: We waited for a long time for the Train to the top but finally arrived there. It was very hot and humid but we walked around for a while and took some photos then returned to the lower station. I understand there are many activities and walking trails but this time due to health issues, we did not participate. If you enjoy walking this place would be great to spend some time. The Hill has been re-developed and now has Nature walks, activities for the adventurous and a canopy walk to name a few! The Habitat appears to be something worth a look too!

title: History dating back to 1606!
text:
The small but interesting Fort Cornwallis has history that dates back to 1606 when the Dutch presented the Seri Rambai Cannon to the Sultan of Johor and to 1786 when the British East India Company landed in Penang to take possession of Penang Island from the Sultan of Kedah.
There are several cannons lined up on the wall, a Pinang Tree and a statue of Captain Francis Light. The Gunpowder room is worth a look as is the souvenir Store.

title: Many choices for a yummy evening meal!
text: We ate at long Beach several times during our stay at the Park Royal Hotel. There are many different foods to choose from including Chinese, Indian, Japanese, Thai, Satay, Sea food and Western Food. The cost is quite low and the choices are many!!

title: Great place to relax!!
text:
We arrived at the Parkroyal after dark and were greeted by lovely smiles and after check in, a welcome drink in the Javana lounge by the hostess Lorenz.
After moving into our room we went for a walk around the gardens and then sat and listened to the Ark Band in the Javana Lounge until we crashed for the night.
Our room was clean, tidy and very well suplied with amenities. Our balcony looked out over the garden to the sea and provided us many hours to watch the water activities enjoyed by hotel guests.
Complimentary breakfast is served in Cinnamon Asian Kitchen which is clean, tidy and well set out. You can eat inside or in the very wide undercover outdoor areas where the ceiling fans circulate the warm air. From the outdoor area the views of the garden, big tree and double swing are very pleasant.
The staff in Cinnamon are very friendly, polite and helpful, especiall Wahyu who we saw most mornings. Wayhu always greeted us with a smile, polite and funy conversation and assisted us with whatever request we had - he makes a great cappuccino too!!
We ate a few times in Cinnamon for dinner at the buffets and must say what a great range of foods from different cultures were presented for guests to choose from. One waiter Ibid, who served us, also gave us great service with a pleasant smile.
Although we are not swimmers, there are two pools in the hotel gardens, one with a water slide and one that appears more shallow for family groups to spend time with their children in a calmer way. There are always Life Guards on duty whenever people are in the pools. I must also mention the toilets downstairs for guests who use the pools, sun lounges etc ... they are the cleanest and most pleasantly fragrant toilet blocks I can remember using!
We were aware of the Massage service available and had two massages from Basheer who offers massages 3 days per week, his neice Nita and her husband provide massages on other days - I had a foot massage by Nita and thoroughly enjoyed it ... so did my feet!!
We were not happy with only one aspect of our stay here. It was White Eagle Tours. We spoke to their staff on 3 occasions trying to organise our days. We were talked out of going to George Town on one occasion and into booking their driver to take us to Entopia (The Butterfly Farm) and the Batik Factory (where we were to be picked up later) - we were told it was only 600 metres from Entopia to the Batik Factory but in actuallity it was closer to 1.4 kilometers which in the humidity and 30+c temperature was quite a walk for us given our health issues. We also wanted to go into George Town on the hotel shuttle but the White Eagle staff had not told us the shuttle had to be booked the day before and we were told we could not use the shuttle .. so we took a local taxi into George Town and the driver parked and waited for us to visit the attractions and then move on to the next place we wanted to see and drove us back to the Hotel when we were done site-seeing ... and the cost was far less than the tour through White Eagle Tours.

title: Delicious food!
text: We ate here on our last evening in Japan and were very happy with the variety of food available. The service was great and the restaurant was clean, well maintained and the staff were very polite and helpful.

title: Amazing Garden
text: Really enjoyed our walk around the gardens, but would have loved to stayed far longer. The lake and bridges make for wonderful photos. The Garden is surrounded by very tall buildings and your photos show the style of inner city living here. The very old pine tree is well worth a look, as are the many trees and flowering plants growing in the Garden.

title: Fabulous history here
text: This Museum is well worth a visit - great history of the Samuri is shared by the well informed Tour Guide. The shop will post your purchases home for you at reasonable cost .. many great souveniers and T-Shirts to choose form. Would visit again!

title: Quick snacks close to the Keio Plaza Hotel
text: We ate here on 3 occasions and enjoyed the snack meals and delicious Latte flavours and teas. Menus are on the counter so you can point to what you would like to order, if like us you do not speak Japanese - staff are lovely!

title: Great views of Shinjuku from 45 floors high!
text: The weekend we visited was a long weekend so there were a lot of people visiting the area. After a long wait we went up in the elevator to the 45th floor and spent some time exploring the shops and looking at the amazing views across the city. Once we were back on the ground we spent some time wandering arounf the lower area of the Municipal building and saw the statues etc lining the circular area.
place: Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building Observation Decks

title: Very well organised Hotel!
text:
We stayed for 3 nights and were very pleased we had booked this hotel which is within walking distance of the Shinjuku Ststion.
The front counter staff were all very polite, helpful and respectful. Our room was quite large and the Hotel provides a 'Handy' phone which allows free international calls to limited countries and the phone is for guests to take with you when you explore the city - what a bonus!
Make sure you explore all the floors including the lower level and find the delicious icecreams in the Gift shop!!

title: Simply Amazing sight to see!!
text: The Tachi-Neputa House is a museum that displays parade floats featured in the city's Neputa summer festival. These huge floats are 23 metres high and made of wire and rice paper. The workmanship of these floats is simply amazing and the museum's set up allows visitors to walk around to see the floats from all angles along the 3 floors. Well worth a visit!

title: Great views and hiking trails.
text: The ride to the top was uneventful and once there we were able to visit the Raven Eagle Gifts & Gallery, take a short walk behind the Tramway station and there are hiking trails if you enjoy walking !

title: Not so Grumpy!
text: We enjoyed a delicious coffee here at Grumpy's and the young girl who served us was not grumpy at all. A lovely place to sit quietly and enjoy some refreshments or a meal.

title: We saw whales!!
text: We took a whale watching tour with this company and were not dissapointed!! We saw a family of Orcas, many seals and a Bald Eagle. The company guarantee that if you do not see a whale you can return for free - great idea but as we saw whales we did not have to return but I would like to repeat the tour if we return to Vancouver in the future!

title: Nice quiet place to sit!
text: My husband and I had been walking around for quite a while and were ready for a break. We walked up some stairs and found this lovely little Cafe where we sat outside and I enjoyed a refreshing cuppa and my husband enjoyed a cold soda. A lovely place for a quiet break from all the street activity!

title: Not what I expected
text: The Pannini I ordered here was quite dissapointing - I would not order it again but would try a regular Subway meal!

title: A Pub with a great cuppa!
text: We stayed in the St Regis Hotel and ate here (next door) and enjoyed a delicious meal and I even though it is a Bar, I was able to enjoy a nice hot pot of tea with our meal - thank you!!

title: What a ride to the top!
text: The ride to the top is in a glass fronted Elevator which looks out for most of the journey across the city until you reach the top, then you have to 360 degree views to take in ... great way to spend some time and look over Vancouver from up high!!

title: Personal handwritten welcome in your room!
text:
We stayed in this lovely hotel for 3 nights in September 2018. I was delighted to find a hand written note from the General Manager in our room when we arrived. Such a lovely touch!
The St. Regis is well situated close to the Pacific Centre, City Centre Station and in walking distance to Chinatown and Gas Town. We also walked to the Vancouver Lookout which is well worth the effort, the panoramic views are quite amazing.
There were three menu choices for breakfast which is served at your table by the helpful Breakfast Room staff.
I must mention the wonderful front desk staff who were so helpful when we wanted to book a whale watchng tour - so very helpful.
I would definately recommend this Hotel to friends and family travelling to Vacouver. Our 3 night stay was the perfect start to our 4 week holiday.

title: Great night's stay on our way to Heathrow
text:
We arrived late in the afternoon and the room was ready, clean and tidy. There was a kettle with good sized mugs, tea, coffee and milk provided - bonus!!
The bed and pillows were comfy and the room temp could be set to suit.
There are plenty of food choices between the Hotel's Dining room menu and the MOTO complex nearby.
Ample parking is available and free for hotel guests once the vehicle's registration number is listed with the Hotel.

title: Second visit this year - still excellent!
text:
We returned to the Dolphin Bay Suites in September after a delightful stay in May. We returned to the north of Scotland to attend the Highland Military Tattoo at Fort George and to visit more intersting places.
Our unit was again, spotlessly clean when we arrived and when the microwave stopped working, it was replaced within 20 minutes with a new one.
I would recommend the Dolphin Bay Suites to anyone looking for self catering accommodation that overlooks the sea in the north of Scotland.

title: Beautiful old home and fantastic surrounds!
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights on our way to Scotland. The Hotel is a beautiful old country house built around 1911 and is set on 20 acres of landscaped gardens and forests that reach to the shore of Lake Windermere. Make sure you walk around the garden and then down the path to the boat house on the lake shore - the walk and view are really worth doing and the garden's flowers are beautiful.
The house has plenty of lounge areas which are lovely to relax in and read a paper or sip a cup of tea. Some of the rooms are on the small side but the ample lounge areas downstairs make up for the lack of lounging space in the rooms.
We enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to our friends.

title: Nice to drive around
text: The drive around the Lake is quite nice when you can see the water from the road and there are several places to stop and enjoy the views.

title: Beautiful old house and grounds
text: We visited Duff House in September and enjoyed our 90 mins wandering about. We chatted to the guides who were stationed around the house and gave lots of useful information and directions. As Australians we were directed to the two old globes(1700-1800) with one showing the lack of the southern coast of Australia as the globes pre-date the completed mapping of Australia - we really appreciated the guide's time in pointing this out to us. The decorations, furniture and paintings are well worth the time to spend there looking at the many rooms and gaining a smalll glimpse of life in Victorian times.

title: Fort George and the Highland Military Tattoo
text:
We visited #FortGeorge again to watch the #HighlandMilitaryTattoo which we thoroughly enjoyed in spite of the chill wind that blew almost all night - but - it did not rain. :)
The military re-enactments, the music, colour and pagentry were well worth the time and energy to get there.
Personally I enjoyed the 'stroll through history' the enactments played out, from the jacobites to the modern day - very well done.

title: Such history within!!
text: This museum is housed in Fort George and is very informative about the history of the military traditions of the highlands and islands of the Moray
place: The Highlanders' Museum (Queen's Own Highlanders Collection)

title: Excellent tour, vehicle and guide!
text:
We accompanied friends on this tour and could not have wished it to be any better. David Hamilton (driver) has very broad knowledge of Orkney and it's attractions. He was very informative and took time to answer all our questions. The tour moved along well but was not rushed and he had us back at the ship right on time as arranged.
I would recommend Red's Orkney Tours to anyone looking for a tour with someone like David who actually knows the area as he has lived there.

title: Wonderful example of a Z plan tower house
text:
We visited Brodie Castle this September and took a guided tour - non guided tours are available on some days.
The tour commenced in the amazing library and just got better from there. The history hidden in this castle is amazing and the guides share the growth of the castle as each Laird made their own additions. The castle has four floors with the nursery on the top floor with the nanny's rooms. The personal articles that were used by the previous residents are like peeping into history as you see the things from childrens toys, books, the mirrors, porcelain pots/vases to the kitchen equipment on display.
The number of art works in the house is exceptional thanks to the wives of the lairds who were wise enough to gather artwork.
My only complaint is that photography is not allowed but a Brodie Castle book is available for five pounds.

title: Amazing walking where such history took place
text: The visitors centre charges 2 pounds for parking - National Trust members park for free but there are parking spaces half way up the entry road free for non-members and you need to walk for a short distance to reach the Visitors Centre & Battlefield. Inside, there are interactive displays describing the history leading up to the Battle of Culloden then you see a short movie then walk out to the Battlefield where there are gravemarkers indicating the men who fell during the batle, a Cairn and Leanach Cottage. There is a good gift shop, cafe and rest rooms.

title: What a great night!
text: Fantastic night in spite of the cold wind; the music, colour & atmosphere was amazing. The re-enactments were the part I enjoyed the most.
